data.title: Cambodian journalist freed on bail after apologising for 'harmful' posts - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: An award-winning Cambodian journalist who was arrested on charges of inciting social unrest was freed on bail on Thursday, a day after the government released a video of the investigative reporter apologising.

data.title: Evictions and Evasions: State Involvement in Southeast Asia’s ‘Golden Era of Organized Crime’ - The Cambodia Daily

data.description: 163 groups highlight worrying escalation in repression of critical voices in the Hun Manet-led nation.

data.title: Cambodia cracks down on illegal international surrogacy as demand remains high - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Once a hub for affordable surrogacy following restrictions in neighbouring countries, Cambodia is trying to curb the practice because of human trafficking concerns.

data.title: Anutin, Cambodian PM discuss cross-border trade, stronger ties - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The interior minister also expresses commitment to further collaboration as both countries approach the 75th anniversary of diplomatic relations.

data.title: New Zealand, Cambodia cite political risks due to high energy transition costs - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Political risks due to potential loss of public support over rising power tariffs are a major impediment to transitioning to cleaner electricity sources, ministers from New Zealand and Cambodia told an energy industry event.

data.description: Elites are saluted as an award-winning journalist is sent to jail.

data.title: How Japan and South Korea can revitalise Cambodia-US relations - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia is drawing closer to South Korea and Japan in a bid to expand the country’s circle of friendly powers. Such increased engagement with US allies may get the US thinking about its approach to Cambodia, say researchers Sokvy Rim and Olivia Zeiner-Morrish.

data.description: It has taken 60 years and as multi-coloured fireworks filled the sky above the majestic Morodok Techo National Stadium on Friday, Cambodia finally got its moment.

data.title: Ream Naval Base Not For China; US Warships Welcome At Cambodia’s Beijing Aided Port – Deputy PM - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Amid concerns that the Ream Naval Base might be used by the People Liberation Army Navy as a military outpost, Cambodia has said that US ships would also be permitted to visit the base.

data.title: Cambodia’s Autocratic Regime Really Doesn’t Want You Criticizing It Overseas - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: In its attempt to woo Western governments, Prime Minister Hun Manet’s government has sought to choke off critical commentary among overseas Cambodians.

data.title: Rebuilding Cambodian cinema, one actor at a time - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A new generation of Cambodian actors is working to revive the country's film industry, decimated by the Khmer Rouge regime. The Acting Art Academy in Phnom Penh, led by a French filmmaker, provides a unique training ground for these aspiring artists.

data.title: China’s warships gift and funding naval base in Cambodia: Could it put regional dynamics in choppy waters? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Analysts say the twin moves could be part of a deal to secure China preferential rights to use Ream Naval Base in southern Cambodia. The question is how much access China will have to the military installation, and to what ends.

data.description: Cambodian princess Jenna Norodom is reportedly considering becoming a trainee in Korea to debut as an idol, according to a Taiwanese news outlet. data.title: Cambodia says it would welcome US Navy at port expanded with China's help - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia said on Tuesday the U.S. Navy would be welcome to visit its Ream Naval Base, which the Pentagon is concerned will become a Chinese outpost.

data.title: The Sanctioning of Ly Yong Phat: Milestone or Mirage? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Will new U.S. sanctions on one of Cambodia’s most prominent state-affiliated kingpins signal a turning point for Cambodian state organized crime?

data.title: Why Is China Investing In a $1.7 Billion Canal in Cambodia? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The Funan Techo Canal is the latest in a string of flashy Chinese investments in Cambodia. How did Cambodia, a lower-middle-income nation of 17.5 million people, become a focal point of Chinese foreign policy and investment?

data.title: China’s growing infrastructure projects in Cambodia and their geostrategic implications - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: With talk of China possibly looking at Ream Naval Base as its second overseas military base after Djibouti, US academic Chen Xiangming notes that coupling a new canal with even a periodic naval visit at Ream would allow China to monitor the critical shipping lane of the Strait of Malacca from a close geostrategic point.
